name: Theya
headline: The world's simplest Bitcoin self-custody solution
description:
Theya is the world’s simplest Bitcoin self-custody app for users who find crypto exchanges risky and hardware wallets overwhelming. We are making the self-custody UX seamless with our multi-sig wallet that users can set up using smartphones, giving them the functionality and convenience of centralized exchanges without sacrificing control and security of hardware wallets.

We aim to be the default consumer app for Bitcoin - offering products like accumulation, lending, investments and payments - all built on top of our intuitive self-custody platform.

founders.name: Vikas Choudhary, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder/CTO at Theya - building a self-custodial bitcoin private bank. Previously co-founder/CTO at Porter (marketplace for trucking - >$230M revenue; backed by Sequoia Capital, Tiger Global)

founders.name: Smeet Bhatt, Founder
founders.description:
Smeet has background as a tech entrepreneur and investor. Previously, he led marketing and GTM at a YC S18 enterprise software company, Prodigal (Sr A: Accel, Menlo, YC). Smeet was also an investor with IDG Ventures and co-founded Chymera (mobile VR ad-network).

Smeet studied Civil Engineering and Physics at IIT Bombay and has experience trading global macro (equities, bonds, FX, commodities) and growth tech investing for over 8 years. He also believes that Bitcoin is not a choice.

founders.name: Sriram Bhargav Karnati, Founder
founders.description: Sriram is co-founder of Theya. He has led crypto engineering teams at Robinhood, FalconX and GameStop Blockchain. He built crypto custody infrastructure and led the development of self-custody wallets for Robinhood and GameStop. He is a Xoogler who has over 10 years of experience building consumer apps. Sriram graduated with Bachelors in Computer Science from IIT Bombay.

## FAQs

What Is Multisig?
![](https://www.theya.us/_next/static/media/arrow.7babee32.svg)
Multi-signature (multisig) vaults are a sophisticated risk mitigation tool, requiring multiple key signatures for Bitcoin transactions to prevent theft and key loss. They remove single points of failure, ideal for secure self-custody, inheritance, and business use, offering unmatched security for significant Bitcoin holdings and collaborative management.
How Do I Create A Multisig Vault?
![](https://www.theya.us/_next/static/media/arrow.7babee32.svg)
To set up a multisig wallet, you need to control and own at least two private keys while the service provider secures your recovery key. While DIY multisig with open-source wallets is possible, it can be quite anxiety-inducing for beginners and non-technical users. Theya provides an elegant, hassle-free solution for collaborative multisig, ensuring you benefit from superior self-custody technology with added peace of mind. Book a call today!
Can Multisig Wallets Be Hacked?
![](https://www.theya.us/_next/static/media/arrow.7babee32.svg)
The Bitcoin blockchain remains unhacked. Losses usually stem from counter-party risk (like mismanaged exchanges) or user error (such as not protecting seed phrases). Theya's multisig solution bolsters single-sig security, enhancing self-custody assurance by eliminating single points of failure, greatly reducing risks of theft or loss.
Can My Family Access The Vaults In My Absence?
![](https://www.theya.us/_next/static/media/arrow.7babee32.svg)
Shared custody and planning the inheritance of your bitcoin are essential components of your financial planning. Theya offers native options for users to voluntarily share vault access with trusted family members and financial advisors.

### Theya: Simplifying Bitcoin Self-Custody

**Overview**
Founded in 2023 and a proud member of Y Combinator's Batch W23, Theya is headquartered in San Francisco and comprises a tight-knit team of three. Theya's mission is crystal clear: to provide the world’s simplest Bitcoin self-custody solution, catering especially to users who find traditional crypto exchanges intimidating and hardware wallets complex. 

**The Problem They Solve**
For many, the crypto world feels fraught with risk. Users are often torn between the convenience of centralized exchanges and the safety of hardware wallets. Theya steps into this gap by offering a multi-signature (multi-sig) wallet that's compatible with smartphones. It provides a user-friendly experience that's seamless yet secure, giving users the power to safeguard their Bitcoin without drowning in complexity.

**The Vision**
Theya is not just about wallets—it aims to become the go-to consumer application for Bitcoin. Their product lineup is poised to expand into areas like accumulation, lending, investments, and payments—all wrapped within their intuitive self-custody platform. They are building not only a tool, but a way to democratize and simplify Bitcoin ownership.

**Current Offerings**
Theya boasts features such as:
- **Multi-Sig Vaults**: This multi-layered protection requires two out of three keys to approve transactions, greatly enhancing security.
- **Shared Custody**: Users can delegate access to family members or advisors, refining control and security.
- **Sovereign Recovery**: Should a user lose a key or even if Theya were to shut down, your funds remain safe with built-in recovery options.
- Support for popular hardware wallets, enabling seamless integration for users' existing devices.

**Fundamentals**
- **Website**: [Theya](https://www.theya.us/)
- **Founded**: 2023
- **Location**: San Francisco, California
- **Team Size**: 3 members
- **Accelerator**: Y Combinator W23
- **Notable Partner**: Harj Taggar
